title: UPDATE: Play games that matter with /remake

replies.body: What if the person who is afk is just having an issue with their computer or internet and it just takes them that little bit longer to join but do get in? And then punishing them so harshly is bs. Why  not have it be at the 5 min mark at least and allow for their to be deaths and kills.Hardly makes a difference time wise but allows the player having issues to have more time to resolve it. smh

The problem there is, laning phase gets harder the higher elo you are. Missing even a couple of minion waves will put you extremely behind exp/gold wise. Match that with a high elo player who knows how to punish you for being behind and it's gg for the lane phase. You and your team will be constantly playing from behind because 1 person connected 5 minutes into the game. And although it's not impossible to win, it decreases you and your teams chances of winning quite a lot which isn't seen as competitive or fair. I know i'm personally tilted when a team mate connects late and then goes 0/3 in the first few minutes of returning because the other team is punishing them. 

I do believe they should allow kills and deaths though, try to 4v5 with the option to remake rather than sit and afk until you can remake because you don't want to risk giving a death / kill.

So, your saying that because the person loves this game and wants to play it, but they have a bad computer/internet, they should unfairly lose LP before they even get a chance to show that they can still play and still have fun?

Ranked is a competitive environment, if your going to affect the team negatively and cause your team to be at an immediate disadvantage because of your computer, you should play normals. I don't see that as unfair. You might love the game, and that is great, but if you're the cause of your team mates not enjoying the game I believe you should be punished to a degree. No one enjoys having a disadvantage. However, I think 20 odd LP is a lot to lose though and might need to be toned down because some people may legitimately be unable to join for numerous reasons, and that's unfortunate but it shouldn't impact the team.

However in normals, connecting late puts you in a disadvantage for sure, however the results of a loss aren't as impactful to the team as they are in the ranked environment.

Someone would have to join late in ranked games quite often for this change to negatively impact their league experience. Suffering a punishment of LP for connecting 3 minutes late shouldn't be a huge deal or common. And as i mentioned earlier, if it is common look for a fix.

This is true @Raldrid. (I wasn't able to directly reply to your comment).

In a perfect world you shouldn't because it's unfortunate and unpredictable, none of you or your team mates should be penalized for a connection bug within the game. However Riot is pretty good when it comes to disconnects, loading screen is delayed to ensure a disconnected player has enough time to re-join, that and personally it's very rare for me to receive a game crash. Regardless I have never been unable to re-connect to a game after a crash, but perhaps i am just lucky. 

However, 1 loss isn't the end of the world. And if you lose multiple games and lose a ton of LP because of this new system, it may be an issue you have to look into rather than riot. Maybe repair your client or look into troubleshooting internet connection issues. 

But this whole system is looking after the team or victim of a disconnect, rather than the person who is disconnected. You might get frustrated that you lost LP because you didn't connect due to a bug splat or something, but imagine how the other 4 team mates feel when you finally connect after 5+ minutes of being AFK and you're all playing from behind with an increased chance of losing. 

This for me is more common (it's an un-common occurance, however it is more common than myself not able to connect), finding team mates who never join or join late and i'm forced to change my play style and adapt to a disadvantage I personally have no control over. 

Regarding the amount of LP, yes, this is based of your mmr. I mentioned 20 "odd" LP in my previous post as a general mark, as with a matching mmr and league the rough amount of points gained is roughly around 20 points a win.

If the cause for you connecting late is because of the GAME! and not your computer, you should not lose anything. And it isn't 20 Lp exactly, depending on your MMR to the league you are in you will lose different amounts. If you are in S3 but your MMR is B1, you will lose closer to 30. But if you are S3 and MMR is G1, then you lose something like 12.{{summoner:2}}

@willis dog  did you even read what he said " if your going to affect the team negatively and cause your team to be at an immediate disadvantage because of your computer, you should play normals." whether its your computers fault or not you are stull putting your team at a disadvantage

@radrid there is no sure way to check whether its your computer or the game clients fault, while you may be able to tell, i doubt the game can tell
People with unreliable, cheap pc setups should just stick to normals if they cant guarantee their pc will work 100% of the time.

@I Quit. 

That is true and quite unfortunate, I too believe young players who can't afford better computers should be able to have a shot at playing competitively, anyone and everyone should be able to play this game, ranked or not. It's incredibly fun to play casual or test your skills in ranked, which is why this game is so popular. 

And just to clear things up, I didn't say kids or anyone that can't afford good computers should be perma banned from ranked or are bad.

However, this is back to the perspective of the disconnecter, whereas this system is designed for the other 4 remaining team mates which ties back into the negatives and implications of having an AFK on your team.  

Slow loading times is fine, having 30 fps is fine, having a bad computer is fine. But when they start to negatively impact other players it becomes a bit of an issue, and that's what i was trying to highlight here. That being said, anyone with a bad computer are more than free to queue up for ranked and play, but now with this new system it will not punish the other 4 remaining players, which is the goal of this system. The aim is to help the other 4 players out of a loss rather than trying to prevent someone with a bad computer from playing. 

I apologies for my unclear message
I somewhat agree, I do believe if you are un-able to connect before the 3 minute mark for even a majority of your games you should probably avoid ranked.
to me it doesn't matter how talented the person play is. If they cant have a reliable PC then ranked is not for them.   Otherwise its unfair on 4 people rather than just one.   Good remake system.

The point is, whether that person has a bad computer/internet should not be the rest of the teams problem. 

Custom games exist and that person should solve their issues in custom games before going into a match-made game. 

Whether or not that person is unlucky for that one game and its not "his fault" in the sense that the dc wasn't intentional, it certainly isn't fair to hurt the other 4 players chance of winning.

The point is, sometimes the client crash, it even happens in stream, watch Twitch, professional streamers do have issues with their client, and people should be punished for the client crash?

Seriously, who quits on purpose from the very start of a ranked game? It is very rare to see.

i do believe they should allow kills and deaths though, try to 4v5 with the option to remake rather than sit and afk until you can remake because you don't want to risk giving a death / kill. yep but they shouldn't make it a 3 minute mark atleast have it so if there is an afk after 3 mins you can still /remake and maybe give the LP to the other team and no loss of LP for the 4 man team

@PotatoBake

That is a good suggestion! I was thinking of this also, this way the system will still be relevant later in the game in case you have a rage quitter or something and you can still remake and receive no LP loss and the enemy team gains LP even after 30+ minutes :-).

Rule of thumb:
if you have an issue with your computer or internet, don't play ranked.
Then you take responsibility, take the loss then fix your shit before queueing for another RANKED game, where you know, you affect 4 other people and not just yourself.

I would agree if that was the case in normal's. I have had about 3 or 4 afk,s in ranked just in this week alone, 1 came back at about the 10min mark, by that time I had fallen off cs by a ton, has my tower taken due to ganks and 4 people on my tower. After which the roamed top and mid and got a few kills. Also because I was alone ym jungler had to apply more pressure on bot thus allowing top lane to get snowballed by ganks from the enemy jungler. I think if you know you have bad internet or client then don't even consider playing ranked. If that is not the case and you have a bad day where something goes wrong well the tough luck. If it was me I would understand purely because I REALLY know what it is like to have an afk even for a short time rather than the full game.

This will no doubt help out a lot of people, but it has some pretty odd restrictions. Why not just do what DOTA does and allow you to quit if someone hasn't connected at the beginning of the game? Or add that in AS WELL AS this system? Nobody cares if you 'copy' other design apsects as long as they're clearly beneficial for your product.

A lot can happen in the fist 3 minutes. Not allowing a remake if first blood is drawn is a very harsh penalty. Someone may rage quit from an invade or already be afk/disconnected for it, then all of a sudden the enemy team has bonus first blood gold and you're down a player.

It's very likely if people on the enemy team find out its a 4v5 early enough they'll force a first blood, even if it means dying first to ensure they get an easier 5v4 game for that sweet LP gain or promo win.

How about a pause feature? If every game should feel competitive and well-fought why can't we pause the game when a player is disconnected? Often disconnections aren't a direct fault of the player, but rather an external source beyond their immediate control.

I imagine this will help people once a week on average. Perhaps it will help make the community more friendly and understanding of each others plight and it will be utilised more, but overall I strongly believe this has some very obvious weaknesses and flaws that I'm surprised weren't already addressed.

Thoughts? Open for discussion.

There is a /pause feature, but it's only available in tournament draft custom games. It would be simple enough to expand it to all game types, but it could get annoying if people spam it mid teamfight, persay.

"It's very likely if people on the enemy team find out its a 4v5 early enough they'll force a first blood, even if it means dying first to ensure they get an easier 5v4 game for that sweet LP gain or promo win."

That's a very good point. I reckon it might end up with the team of four sitting around doing nothing, as someone's already pointed out.

I think the biggest difference between this "Remake" system and the "Abandon" system is that this has a vote which is quite nice. Being able to just quit does seem a little harsh on those in the disadvantaged team who want to play on. Then again, the voting system could have a similar effect to the surrender system whereby one team mate puts up a surrender vote but everyone else instantly clicks the NO button - the person who raised the vote might feel discouraged to even try. This effect isn't too big when you're at the twentieth minute of a [possibly] horribly losing game but when someone's just given up hope and throwing themselves at the enemy team because the remake vote didn't get through at the third minute, well it's probably going to be the longest 17 minute period you've played LoL through.

I think it's important to have the "No first blood" condition, which is also a condition for Early Abandon. Just to make sure it isn't "Hey all of them are our perfect counters, let's just remake!"

My problem with this system is say its at the 2 minute mark, and the enemy mid laner hasnt shown his face, whats stopping the top laner from just turret diving, dying, giving first blood to the enemy to secure the easy 4v5 win?

Need to change one thing in the rules. Instead of preventing the /remake option at FirstBlood, it should be changed to, if any non-afk player of the team with 4, dies, /remake wont appear. 

As of now, an enemy team member, can see that the player did not connect, and give First blood, in order for the game to continue. So they will win the game later, even after giving first blood.
Sometimes my friend would keep getting these bug splat things but he would eventally reconnect. plz dont add /remake its stupid.
I think that the voting should be triggered automatically and let the players decide...

Good idea, shit implementation. Really, really shit implementation. But you are going down the right track.

Let's make it SERIOUS when you talk about making the game feel like it should, because let's face it, 90% of the games that are 4v5 loses having nothing to do with the first 3 minutes, nor does that give you any indication if you should continue to fight out the game or not.

Some 4v5 games are 4v5 late in the game where someone on the losing team decides "fuck it, I'm leaving" when if they had stuck around they could have pushed for late game and won. There are also those who drop out of the winning side and forces them to lose.

Having a set rule of 3 minutes and 90 seconds give nothing, nor does it really punish the player who left. You need to have a grading scale based on how long the game has been going on for and therefore how much time the player has to come back.

That is, is a game has been going for 20 minutes and someone DC's and does not come back for say 180 seconds, than you can call the game. If the game has been on for 30 minutes, make it 210 seconds or something.

A game that has been going for longer has less chance to turn one sided when someone DC's, and it could be a legitimate DC so you need to allow sufficient time to come back. But if they don't come back, call it.

But don't just give them a leaver buster and a single games worth of LP lose, give them a harder punishment the longer they have been away for. You give them more time to come back and a harder penalty if they don't, simple.
This is a nice additive but what about rage quitters? I had two games only recently where someone died twice then left and never game back. This doesn't help me at all with that now does it.

I don't have any stats on this but most of the time the dc'd player is only dc'd for less than 5-10 min, due to either a game bug or not hearing the starting sound. I feel like 3 minutes is too short of a time for the dc'd player to come back.

Can someone please help me out with this. I'm curious to know about the first blood rule in more detail.

Now it states that if a player DC's or leaves after first blood, then you can not remake the game. What I want to know is, does this rule apply if the player is afk? Like, if we fed first blood (not intentionally) at the minute mark, but the player in question was 60 seconds through his afk, and was afk for a further 30 seconds more, would remake still be available?
I'm on a Mac and if I can connect before 3 minutes in or even earlier than that, you should all be able to do it..

Surely you all can understand where riot is coming from? If it is a 4v5 then one would assume that the team lacking a player should naturally realise this and in effect adjusting the way you play accordingly. It is the duty of the team to avoid any kind of fight if they are attempting a /remake. If the opposition are willing to waste 5 flashes into your base at 2 minutes to prevent a remake I would say that they deserve it hahaha, It is a high risk high reward situation but to avoid that communicate to your team and tell them not to leave base so cancellation of the game will remain valid.

 {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
maybe add a ping sensor anything so people can check the connection be for they start a game

> or at least 30% of the players on the voting team to agree

Come on Riot, who taught you guys basic mathematics? {{item:3070}} 
2/5 is the same as 2x20/5x20, which is 40/100 or 40% (including all players)
2/4 is the same as 2x25/4x25, which is 50/100 or 50% (not including the afk)

Whichever one you meant, it does not equal 30% of the players on the voting team.
Riot why dont you take suggestions from the players instead of your own dumb ideas

So what happens if your in a low priority queue when /remake happens? Is it still counted as one of your five games or do you have to wait another 20 minutes just because someone on your team was afk?

Whilst this solution is a step in the right direction it only accounts for like 5% of afk situations in games. Most of the time people dc after the 3 min mark or just leave the game because they were having a bad time. 

Why not just allow the team to Forfeit before 20 mins with the afk, take reduced lp loss (say 33% of original loss) and increase the lp loss for the disconnected player?

For the issue you seem to be handling (people who just dont connect) it would be an easier idea to just have the game not start (time set at 0:00, everyone still in that small base area where they cant leave) untill either the player connects or 3:00 minutes pass and the game disbands. Nobody will vote to keep playing before 3:00 when they have an afk and the limitations of no kills just means that people will stay in base anyway so they dont risk dying and losing the chance of a remake, meaning if the person actually reconnects they are at a disadvantage anyway.
So if you're diamond, it doesn't matter, you get the loss anyways? wtf is this logic, punish people for being ok at the game?
This is genius unless there are trolls but nowadays not many trolls, everyone is competitive

The biggest issue I see with this is; I have been in hundreds of games where i've been watching the load screen for 10 minutes, waiting, thinking it's some person's toaster taking forever to load, but in reality the client doesn't even realise you have disconnected from the game server. And until you force close the client at 5-10 minutes and restart it and his reconnect, you don't even know you've been disconnected and the game is 5 minutes in.

I would be penalized for such a thing, which is extremely unfortunate. I have no PC issues, never have when it comes to League, i've played League on multiple PCs with the same issue on all of them, from different connections at that, it's definitely not a client side "fix your computer" issue. It's a server-client comm. issue, always has been.
What is said afk comes into the game feeds first blood on purpose and then dc's just so people cant remake. should really get rid of the first blood thing imo

That's you're answer for AFK players? how about ban them for longer. 

If you don't think you have time to play a game don't queue, simple.

From what I can see they've thought about this a fair bit. If this could be triggered later on in the game, then if the other team was winning, they don't get that LP despite the fact that they were playing a game for 18/30/or even 45 minutes, just for this to happen. You can't fix this by giving the winning team LP anyway, as they would all climb, whilst the other team won't lose LP despite the fact they were losing anyway.

I think the punishments should be reduced, as the player loses 20 LP, for what is most likely either a client or server bug. If it is a problem with the technology of the player, this should be easily monitored by graphical settings/ FPS rates seen throughout games that given player has played. If the settings are low and/or the frame rates are really low, its due to the hardware, not the software.

I think Riot is onto something here, and whilst it isn't perfect, they've definitely put a lot of thought into all of this, and are taking a step in the right direction.

After 4 years,
its finally here!
what is to stop the other team feeding you one kill to stop a remake?
Once again the Howling Abyss isnt included. This is a system that it could benefit from..... {{item:3151}}
You are missing the real problem, people who feed then afk, I get more of them in game then people who don't connect.

I totally agree to this new remaking system, and yes, it would need to be tested out.
Now after reading all these comments I do believe that there should be a sequential decision on the call itself. Have 2 notifications, one after the 3min mark, and if there is an agreement to a remake, then the next call to confirm the remake will come after the 7min mark. That way you can nut out the AFK's to the people with connection issues.
This system would work better if Riot did take out the deaths and kills aspect of it, that shouldn't matter whatsoever if there really is an AFK in the game.
So I completely and utterly agree to many of "Soviax The Llama" responses and Riot for trying to creating this AFK system for the gamers, yet I also believe that it should be placed in EVERY game mode, including Arams and other games, besides Classic Rift. Though Riot would need to eliminate the death and kills score, it's not needed in my opinion, people will find a kill just to continue the game to get an easy win. Pathetic trolls everywhere in OCE.
